page.title: 16THE COBHAM FELLOWSHIP
page.content:
David Taylor, a member of the Fellowship and local historian, said that the Fellowship was started 15 years ago by a group of 4 or 5 people who were disillusioned with the main churches. Originally intended for Cobham people , they met in one of the members' houses. Now there are 300 members (including children) from many parts of Surrey. Every 3 months there is an open meeting in Guildford, drawing people from London and the Home Counties.
The Fellowship members want to have a relationship with God through Jesus Christ on a day-to-day basis. As a group they want to share their lives together.
